intro: Schismatoglottis merrillii, commonly known as the Philippine velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant features broad, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Schismatoglottis merrillii is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
